989.question: How much better peformance is achieved in human evaluation when model is trained considering proposed metric?

6-Table1-1.png: The performance improvement in human evaluation when the model is trained considering the proposed metric is 0.49% (0.50% - 0.01%).</s>

The performance in human evaluation improves by 0.19 when the model is trained considering the proposed metric, as indicated by the increase from 0.49 in the 'with skill rating' approach to 0.68 in the 'Proposed' approach.</s>
6-Table2-1.png: The performance in human evaluation when the model is trained considering the proposed metric is 0.13% better than when it is not considered.</s>
The performance in human evaluation when the model is trained considering the proposed metric is 0.13 points better, as indicated by the p-value of 0.013.</s>

989.answer:
Pearson correlation to human judgement - proposed vs next best metric
Sample level comparison:
- Story generation: 0.387 vs 0.148
- Dialogue: 0.472 vs 0.341
Model level comparison:
- Story generation:  0.631 vs 0.302
- Dialogue: 0.783 vs 0.553
